Message.Title: Yhoo beats Google
Message.Msg: ADGOOROO reports that A surprise, however, was to see Yhoo Ads come out ahead in the Financial Services category with an edge of over a million ad impressions. The study authors speculate that this lead is driven by the popularity of financial reporting on the Yahoo! and MSN portals, which direct reader searches to the Yahoo! Bing engine. In fact, AdWords doesn’t have a significant lead in impression serving in the other four verticals either.

Topic.Title: Help

Message.Msg: Ok, I was directing you to the HELP section for Yahoo, but lets face it, you have to write them, they send you back a standard reply by then you probably have fixed it yourselfe.. So, if you don't know if it's a problem with your M.S. browser then you can always try going back to the very start,, open up another account with Yahoo under another name, If it is a problem with M.S. then upgrade, remember Yahoo is going through upgrades of it's own so things might take awhile to settle. I had to do this very same thing with Merrill Lynch acc. even they said it's the only way.. goodluck.

Message.Title: Does Yahoo dump MSFT regarding search deal, get a new partner, or take over Bing?
Message.Msg: RPS is “revenue per search,” and according to the original agreement between Yahoo and Microsoft, the deal is supposed to be earning Yahoo an agreed RPS. If not, Microsoft has to make up the difference. The agreed RPS has never been reached since the deal began. This became a big issue last year, when Yahoo got louder about blaming Microsoft for the deal not producing the anticipated revenues (see The Yahoo Search Revenue Disaster). Microsoft is on-the-hook to pay a guaranteed minimum amount. Those guarantees were set to expire on March 31 of 2012, but in October 2011, Yahoo announced that Microsoft had agreed to continue paying guaranteed amounts through March 31 of 2013, for search activity happening in the US and Canada. This is the escape clause.....They will either renew or get a much better deal is MSFT or totally change partners....

Topic.Title: Does Yahoo dump MSFT regarding search deal, get a new partner, or take over Bing?

Message.Msg: D. None of the above

Message.Msg: there is more of a chance to buy MM (Millennial Media)....now almost at it's low, would fit into Marissa's plans for mobile. VELT loses a huge amount of money and MM will be profitable next quarter. Yahoo, has been rumored to be interested in buying Zynga (ZNGA), OpenTable (OPEN), Yelp (YELP) and Millennial Media (MM), among others.....VELT is never talked about lately.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Japan to deepen ties with Softbank, Nikkei reports

Message.Msg: What is interesting is that because Softbank owns almost half of the company, so they cannot deferred YJ growth just because YHOO owns 35% stakes. Their major problem ' however, they want YHOO out but they have to pay with huge premium. So, the longer of not making a deal with MM, the buyout $$$$ is keep growing up. So YHOO shares is riding this YJ fortune fortunately with YHOO shareholders too. Hold it MM until Softbank and YJ management give you a premium you like.

Topic.Title: Does Yahoo dump MSFT regarding search deal, get a new partner, or take over Bing?

Message.Msg: According to the agreement between Yahoo and Microsoft, the deal is supposed to be earning Yahoo and Microsoft an agreed combined RPS for the first 18 months, if not; Microsoft has to make up the difference. Microsoft then agreed to continue paying Yahoo a guaranteed amount through March 31 of 2013. Yahoo! may terminate the Search Agreement if the trailing 12-month average of the RPS in the United States of Yahoo! and Microsoft’s combined queries falls below a specified percentage of Google Inc.’s estimated RPS measured on a comparable basis or if the combined Yahoo! and Microsoft query market share in the United States falls below a specified percentage. The combined queries have not fallen below the specified percentage of Google Inc.’s estimated RPS since Microsoft has gained in RPS while Yahoo has lost in RPS. And the deal does say combined queries not Yahoo queries. So there is no reason for Microsoft to renew, no reason to offer a better deal and no escape for Yahoo.

Topic.Title: Does Yahoo dump MSFT regarding search deal, get a new partner, or take over Bing?

Message.Msg: I can't respond to your question directly so I'll answer here. To compete in search with Google is expensive and a waste of time. Yahoo will slowly pull away from Microsoft while doing everything possible to partner with Google.

Topic.Title: buying back shares

Message.Msg: Shares buyback in YHOO current situation is I think a very superb strategy.Owning an assets (Alibaba and YJ stakes) growing briskly that affect directly market value as well as shareholders values (less outstanding shares), eventually positvely impacted price per share. YHOO is a perfect example of a timely shares buyback stragtegy. We should to get to $26 soon!!
